creditline: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Edward A. Foster, 1965
text: William Morris's writings on the Arts and Crafts movement didn't appear in French journals until 1892, but André Marty already shared one of Morris's major beliefs: society would be better if artists applied their talents to everyday objects. As this print's title indicates, L'Estampe originale subscribers were expected to remove this lithograph from the album and use it as a wall hanging.
title: Panneau décoratif (Decorative Panel)
